page.title: 11FOOTPATHS
page.content: There are 20 footpaths on the present definitive map of this area. A number are due to be transferred from their old routes to others, more suitable for the landowners. Footpaths are a heritage from the days when the only means of travel was horseback or walking. Today they are protected by the Parish Council, residents and the Ramblers Association. The South Eastern side of{Bredon {Hill,}with wonderful views over the vale of Evesham to the Lickeys in the North, the Cotswolds in the East and the Severn Valley to the South is very popular with walkers. The Wychavon Way passes through the parish and runs along the Eastern ridge of the hill, making use of old bridleways and the footpath through the churchyard to the village street. It is marked with yellow arrows and a stylised'W'symbol.
